title: Every year, 46 million Americans deal with mental illness. Only 41% get help. Here's how you can.
text:
(CNN) An estimated 46 million American adults experience mental illness in a given year but only 41% get help for it, according to the National Alliance on Mental Illness. The problems range from depression and anxiety to substance abuse.

A big reason why so many don't seek help is stigma. But there's no shame in finding a listening, caring voice. Sometimes just being heard and discussing solutions is all it takes.

Here's how to find help -- from employee benefits to free and sliding scale counseling services.

Employer mental health benefits

According to a report by the Society for Human Resource Management, 81% of US employers offer mental health benefits. But many employees don't take advantage of them.
description: One in five adults in the U.S. experience mental illness in any given year but less than half get help.  Here's how you can find help for depression, anxiety and addiction.
